title-part.text: REMOVAL OR TREATMENT OF COMBUSTION PRODUCTS OR COMBUSTION RESIDUES

reference.text: combustion apparatus for consuming smoke or fumes, e.g. exhaust gases, F23G7/06

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers the cleaning of external surfaces of water tubes of boilers

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Removing ash, clinker, or slag from combustion chambers

CPC-specific-text.text: removing flyash from flue gas F23J15/022;

reference.text: devices for removal of material from the bed of fluidised bed combustion apparatus F23C10/24

title-part.text: Apparatus for removing ash, clinker, or slag from ash-pits, e.g. by employing trucks or conveyors, by employing suction devices
Hand tools, e.g. rakes, prickers, tongs

reference.text: forming part of the grate F23H

title-part.text: Removing solid residues from passages or chambers beyond the fire, e.g. from flues by soot blowers

title-part.text: Systems for accumulating residues from different parts of furnace plant
Arrangement of devices for supplying chemicals to fire
Preventing premature solidification of molten combustion residues
Devices for conducting smoke or fumes, e.g. flues

reference.text: chimney stacks E04H12/28; removing cooking fumes from domestic stoves or ranges F24C15/20

CPC-specific-text.text: ; fume conduits of furnaces, kilns, ovens, or retorts F27D17/002

title-part.text: for conducting smoke or fumes originating from various locations to the outside, e.g. in locomotive sheds, in garages
Smoke conduit systems for factories or large buildings

reference.text: side-supporting means for chimney stacks E04H12/20; ladders permanently attached to chimneys E06C9/00; draught-inducing apparatus associated with chimneys or flues F23L17/00; tops for chimneys, terminals for flues F23L17/02

reference.text: terminals for balanced flue arrangements F23L17/04

Arrangements of devices for treating smoke or fumes

title-part.text: Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
Balanced flues (combining air supply and flue gas exhaust)
Common flues for several combustion devices
Chimney or flue associated with building ventilation system
Chimney with internal flue pipe system
Reducing species generators, e.g. plasma, corona
Sorption devices using carbon, e.g. coke
Sorption with wet devices, e.g. scrubbers
Sorption with semi-dry devices, e.g. with slurries
Sorption with dry devices, e.g. beds
Ash removal, handling and treatment means
Ash and slag handling in pulverulent fuel furnaces
Ash removal, handling and treatment means
Ash and slag handling in pulverulent fuel furnaces
Special arrangements for conducting or purifying combustion fumes
Sorting and classifying ashes or fly-ashes from the combustion chamber before further treatment
Cooling of ashes from the combustion chamber by indirect heat exchangers
Ash crushing means associated with ash removal means
Airlock sealing associated with ash removal means
Thermal treatments of ash, e.g. temper or shock-cooling for granulation
Controls related to ash or slag extraction
Removing ashes from the ash pit using reciprocating means, e.g. pushers
Conducting systems with a gas flow bypass from main flue to an auxiliary flue
Modelling systems adapted for designing arrangements for conducting or purifying combustion fumes, e.g. flues
Preventing or reducing corrosion in chimneys
Initial heating of the flue before starting combustion
Means for reducing the noise in smoke conducing ducts or systems
Water draining devices associated with flues
Protections for chimneys or flue tops against external factors, e.g. birds
Devices for heating the chimney top to avoid ice formation
Means for supporting the lining of conducting means, e.g. ducts or chimneys
Manufacturing processes for the lining of conducting means, e.g. by extrusion
Irradiating fumes with electron or light beams, e.g. UV, for oxidizing or dissociating SOx and NOx
Cleaning fumes by letting them to pass a molten metal bath
Preventing plume emission at chimney outlet
Preventing emission of hexavalent chromium at the chimney outlet
Preventing emission of CO2 at the chimney outlet by using sea weeds filters or absorbers
Means for absorbing SOx using seawater
Deep cooling or freezing of flue gas rich of CO2 to deliver CO2-free emissions, or to deliver liquid CO2
